snippet: Nearly two years after Mary McConnell Bailey’s death, the depth of her wealth is being revealed in large gifts to the New York Public Library and the Central Park Conservancy.
abstract: Donations totaling about $20 million have begun flowing to the New York Public Library and the Central Park Conservancy from estate of Mary McConnell Bailey; private and quiet New Yorker, who died without an obituary or services in February, 2011, left little hint of the fortune she planned to bequeath on two favorite city institutions.

byline.original: By RAY RIVERA and AL BAKER

lead_paragraph: Nearly two years after Mary McConnell Bailey’s death, the depth of her wealth is being revealed in large gifts to the New York Public Library and the Central Park Conservancy.

headline.seo: $20 Million in Donations to Public Libraries and Central Park
headline.main: After Modest Life, Huge Gift to 2 Charities
headline.print_headline: After Modest Life, Huge Gift to 2 Charities
